To start a cryptocurrency exchange business, follow these steps:

1. Research the market: Understand the current market scenario and research different crypto exchanges. Get familiar with leading cryptocurrencies, trading volumes, trending news about digital currencies, and global regulatory environment.

2. Create a business plan: Write down your goals for starting this business in terms of revenue generation, target audience demographics or psychographics), timeline to launch, funding needs (if any), financial projections over 3-5 years and risk mitigation plans.

3. Regulatory compliance: Familiarize yourself with legal frameworks regarding cryptocurrency transactions in various countries/regions where you intend to establish operations. Seek professional advice from experienced lawyers who specialize in blockchain technology & digital currency law.

4. Set up your team: Assemble a team of experts on finance/crypto/blockchain development/business management/marketing/security/legal matters as per your required skill set.

5. Technical infrastructure setup:
    - Choose between developing your platform from scratch or partnering with an experienced software vendor which offers customizable white-label solutions.
    - Make sure security is given top priority by implementing multi-signature wallets support; SSL encryption for data transfer; two-factor authentication etc.
